TEXT MINUTE ENTRY for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart in Lincoln on 10/15/2013 as to defendant Joseph J. Benz. Initial Appearance on Indictment held. Appointment of counsel waived. Defendant has retained counsel. Arraignment on Indictment held. Not guilty plea entered. Detention hearing held, government does not oppose release on conditions. Trial set 12/16/2013 before Judge Kopf. Pretrial motions to be filed by 11/14/2013. Counsel to comply with local rules regarding discovery. Progression order to be issued. Defendant released on conditions, order forthcoming. Courtroom Deputy: Jeri A. Bierbower. Reporter: Digital Recorder. Appearance for Plaintiff: Steve Russell; For Defendant: Bob Creager, Retained. Time Start: 2:03 PM; Time Stop: 2:20 PM; Time in Court: 17 Minutes. (JAB) (Entered: 10/15/2013)

MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Joseph J. Benz. The government's motion (filing no. 54 ) is granted. The Bureau of Prisons shall conduct an examination of Benz and submit a report to the Court pursuant to 18 U.S.C. §§ 4242, 4247(b), and 4247(c)(4)(B) addressing the question of whether Benz was insane at the time of the offense charged. Benz is committed to the Bureau of Prisons in order that the foregoing examination may be conducted. He shall self-surrender, at his own costs, to the facility designated by the Bureau of Prisons at the date, time and place designated by the Bureau of Prisons, and shall be released to return to Nebraska, at his own costs, upon completion of the foregoing examination. The Clerk shall provide Ms. Bare with a copy this Memorandum and Order. The Clerk shall provide the United States Marshals Service with a copy of this Memorandum and Order, and the United States Marshals Service shall notify the Bureau of Prisons of this Memorandum and Order. My chambers shall call this matter to my attention in 120 days. The trial of this matter is continued until further order of the court. The time between today's date and the date of the Bureau of Prisons' submission of its report to the Court is excluded from computation under the Speedy Trial Act in the interests of justice. See 18 U.S.C. § 3161. Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (GJG)(1 Certified copy to USM; Copy to Probation Officer as directed) (Entered: 04/21/2015)

MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Joseph J. Benz. The government's second motion in limine (filing no. 48 ) is denied. The defendant may present expert psychological testimony at trial if but only if the defendant proceeds with an insanity defense. On or before December 23, 2015, the defendant shall file an affidavit establishing that he has consulted with counsel at least twice subsequent to this ruling regarding the risks and rewards of pursuing an insanity defense. The affidavit shall also confirm (if it is true) that Benz has been given a copy of, and has personally read and understands, 18 U.S. Code § 4243 and this Memorandum and Order. On Tuesday, December 1, 2015, counsel shall jointly contact my judicial assistant to schedule the "on the record" status conference contemplated by this Memorandum and Order. That status conference should be held over a noon hour and it will take place in the courtroom. It should be scheduled sometime shortly after December 25, 2015, and not before. The time between today's date and the status conference contemplated by this Memorandum and Order shall be excluded from computation under the Speedy Trial Act in the interests of justice. Specially, I make this exclusion in order to provide for the fair and just presentation of the defendants affirmative defense of insanity. 18 U.S. Code § 3161 (h)(7)(A)&(B). Ordered by Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf. (GJG) (Entered: 11/24/2015)

TEXT MINUTE ENTRY for sentencing proceedings held before Senior Judge Richard G. Kopf in Lincoln on 09/07/2016 as to defendant Joseph J. Benz. The court accepts the revised presentence report. Government's Objection to the Tentative Findings 117 is overruled. Defendant's Motion for Variance is granted 116 . The court denies restitution request for the 4th victim because the request came in late and the request is insufficient. Defendant was found guilty on Count II of the Indictment and is sentenced to Probation for a term of 5 years with standard and special conditions, and pay $100 (Paid) special assessment. Defendant is ordered to pay restitution in amount of $3,333 to each of 3 victims for a total of $9,999. Defendant shall forfeit the items set forth in the Indictment to the United States. On the court's own motion, Count I of the Indictment is vacated. Defendant is released on terms and conditions set forth by the court. Appearance for Plaintiff: Steven Russell; Defendant: Robert B. Creager, Retained; Probation Officer: J.R. Holder; Courtroom Deputy: Connie Schultz; Court Reporter: digital; Time Start: 12:05 p.m. Time Stop: 1:28 p.m. Time in Court: 1 Hour 16 Minutes. (CS) (Entered: 09/07/2016)
